child.tree-val: Prehistoric linguistic relationships of Tai-Kadai: Lee 2011, 2012
child.publications: Lee, Hugo Y. H. 2011. Some Remarks on Reconstructing the Prehistoric Linguistic Relationships of the Tai-Kadai Language Family and Its Putative Linguistic Affiliations with Other Language Families: A Review Article, International Review of Social Sciences and Humanities, 1 edn., vol. 2, 163-175. , Clontz, Jack & Hugo Y.-H. Lee. 2012. Reviewing the prehistoric linguistic relationships of the Tai–Kadai language family and its putative linguistic affiliations: a meta–analysis study and abbreviation edition, Journal of Liberal Arts, 1 edn., vol. 4, 20-38.
child.pub-comments: Lee includes the hypothesis that the ancient Baiyue languages, about which little is known, were an outgrowth of Tai-Kadai and thereby an ancestor of some modern Tai-Kadai languages, but he also addresses the possibility that any similarities found are merely the result of language contact (Lee 2011: 169-171).
